intro: Xanthophyllum maingayi, commonly known as the golden leaf tree, is a tropical plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive yellowish-green foliage and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is known for its ornamental value due to its vibrant leaves. Xanthophyllum maingayi typically grows as an understory plant in rainforests, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for horticulturists and botanists alike.
